newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit stays weak, profit-taking limits fall.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit stays weak, profit-taking limits fall.

text.p: * Ringgit remains weak on offshore dollar bids
* Sales by exporters and profit-taking above 2.78 limit dollar's rise
The ringgit remained weak against the dollar in early Asian trading on Friday, but its fall was limited by dollar sales by exporters and profit-taking, dealers said.
At 0230 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.7880/900 to a dollar. It closed at 2.7650/700 in Kuala Lumpur on Thursday.
"U.S. funds are strongly bidding the dollar. They are taking whatever the market can offer," said a European bank dealer in Singapore. "It's a weekend factor."
Dealers said the worst was not over for the ringgit given its weak sentiment and the volatility in the regional currencies.
They said the risk to the 2.80 level and beyond remained intact though a strong resistance was expected at 2.7950.
